blogPost.title: Unsure Of Where Your Career Is Moving? How Organizations Can Help.
blogPost.content:
Sometimes, it is easy for organizations to lose great employees if too few opportunities are available for their upliftment and growth. Most times, the employee himself is unsure where his career is chartered towards. They think the organization has no growth and tend to leave, not understanding that the vicious circle begins as soon as he joins his next stint. According to LinkedIn's workforce report, 93% of employees are willing to continue in their present organization if the latter invests in their career development.

 

In both circumstances, the organization stands to lose the most since it can cost businesses more than the amount lost on the employee's salary, both recruitment and diminished productivity combined. The Employee Retention Report by the Work Institute reported that 1 in 4 employees would leave their job. However, with proper Learning & Development (L&D) strategies, employers can prevent 77% of that turnover. Therefore, regardless of the exact dollar value, retaining employees is more cost-effective than the costs associated with separation, recruitment, and the hit to productivity.

 

According to the same report, companies that spend at least $1,500 per employee annually report earning 24% more profit than those with smaller L&D budgets. But how do organizations define what exactly do they need for the upliftment, skilling or growth of their employees? How do they determine what skills each employee needs to achieve their career aspirations? What can organizations do to charter the career graph of their employee in the right direction?

 

The fact is that it's challenging for anyone in the organization to understand what the employee wants. Why? Because the career aspirations will be different. The skilled landscape is evolving. And what do you keep up with? However competent a resource manager is, they can't keep up with skill sets that match what the employee or employer wants. That's where EDGE Pathfinder becomes an exciting product for the benefit of the employee and the organization. 

 

Built on our Smart AI EDGE GraphTM - an astute knowledge graph, which has analyzed over 10 million job descriptions and 35 million candidate profiles, EDGE Pathfinder puts the employee in the centre and simplifies employee engagement. It enables the employee to look at her current skills and define her aspirational skills and job profile. The AI-powered EDGE Pathfinder then shows her the present jobs available in the organization, matching those skills. Now, the employee can decide to apply for the ones that immediately match her skills or choose to do a few courses, training, etc., suggested by EDGE Pathfinder to reach the next level, since it shows her the skill gap between what she has, versus what the job requires. There are a couple of stops on the way. So, the employee can systematically work on those steps to reach her next job profile faster. In that process, the employee can also define specific preferences like domain, location, reporting manager etc. Now, the organization doesn't have to worry whether the employee is choosing something which the organization is not able to meet. It also shows some very interesting things like what the trending skills in the organization are. There may be times when an employee sees a skill, is interested in learning it, but is unsure how it could help her career path. She may talk about a skill but may never know that there's a skill cluster to which it belongs, and the employee can quickly jump a job within the organization by just doing an adjacency skill upgrade. So, all these things are possible through EDGE Pathfinder.

 

It's mutually harmonious stuff where the employee can chart her career graph, and the organization can guide them in the right direction. This is what makes EDGE Pathfinder a kind of a lifetime tool for the employee in her journey. Thus, putting the employee in the centre of all talent decisions makes the employee feel valued, engaged, and future proof in your organization, thereby making the organization more efficient and future proof. At EDGE, this is how we use tech for good.
